task.title: Adjusting the Clutch
task.shortdesc: Proper clutch adjustment involves accessing and adjusting the clutch finger set screws, with special attention to maintaining equal adjustments across all fingers.

prereq.p: Ensure the vehicle is stationary and in a safe working position.

context.p: Over time, normal wear may require clutch adjustment. This procedure details the steps for adjusting the clutch finger set screws.

step.info: The plate is located under the floor boards at the driver's feet

step.cmd: Remove the cotter key from the first clutch finger
Adjust the first clutch finger set screw

substep.cmd: Using a screwdriver, turn the set screw Â½ to 1 full turn to the right

step.cmd: Repeat the adjustment for all remaining clutch finger set screws
step.info: Ensure each screw receives exactly the same number of turns

result.p: The clutch adjustment is complete when all set screws have been equally adjusted and all cotter keys are properly replaced.

postreq.note: After extended service, if adjustment screws have been turned in significantly, consider installing new clutch discs rather than continuing to adjust the current ones.

When working with small tools or objects near the transmission case, always attach them to a wire or cord. Items dropped into the transmission case are extremely difficult to retrieve without removing the transmission cover.
